contents:
Let’s get started! This blog is here to document what happens with our new Cloud Castle, the apartment we bought in a place called Cloud Castle in an 100+ year Mental Institute.
I’ll cover the plans for home automation, networking, computing, storage, electric vehicle and other topics as the plans for the move get more real. We have various setups in our current apartment but as we’re moving to a new place, built just a couple of years ago, it’s time to “think fresh”, update what needs to be updated.
title: Introduction

contents:
Networking – let’s think about cables first.
In our current apartment we have ethernet wall plates around the apartment but as this has been built 10+ years ago, the cabling is probably Cat5e or so as it cannot handle anything above 1 GbiT/s that well. The internet connection is HFC cable service with Sagecom’s F-3686AC modem at 1 Gbit/s speed.
The service provider, DNA, has been pretty stable and the performance is consistent and one can do 900+ Mbit/s. DNA also gives a /56 IPv6 prefix with DHCPv6-PD.
In the new apartment there will be Elisa’s fiber service for up to 1 Gbit/s. This should be a bit faster as it’s native ethernet service but unfortunately Elisa doesn’t do IPv6 over fixed connections yet.
There are all ethernet wall plates around the apartment but the details are still unknown. As a new installation it might be capable of doing 2.5 or 5 Gbit/s.
